intro: Psychotria crassiflora, commonly known as the purple passionvine, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant purple to violet flowers, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a glossy surface and a strong, somewhat unpleasant odor. Psychotria crassiflora is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
